column4: adding user account to a group: "sudo nano -w /etc/group" and edit the group by adding user account name to it i.e. after last colon in line with a space after that colon, or after the previous user account preceded by a comma separator eg fuse:x:139:username1,username2
note 139 may not be the UID for fuse
always use 'adduser user group' or 'gpasswd -a user group'
